greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of endofunctions f on [n] that are self-inverse on [k] but not on [k+1]; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
comment: T(n,k) counts endofunctions f:{1,...,n}-> {1,...,n} with f(f(i))=i for all i in {1,...,k} and f(f(k+1))<>k+1 if k<n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
mathematica: g[n_] := g[n] = If[n<2, 1, g[n-1] + (n-1)*g[n-2]]; H[0, 0] = 1; H[n_, k_] := Sum[Binomial[n-k, i]*Binomial[k, i]*i!*g[k-i]*n^(n-k-i), {i, 0, Min[k, n-k]}]; T[n_, k_] := H[n, k] - H[n, k+1]; Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 10}, { k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 19 2017, translated from Maple *)
xref: Column k=0 gives A076728 for n>1.
Cf. A245348, A245693 (the same for permutations).
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 29 2014
